column1: sweet-potato-dumplings-44891|Sweet Potato Dumplings|Spray a 13 X 9 X 2 inch baking pan.Flatten each biscuit with a rolling pin.Add 1 heaping tablespoonful of sweet potato to the center of each biscuit; fold in half and crimp the edges to seal.Lay in pan appx.8 per side.You can overlap them.Combine butter
column4: and water in a saucepan and bring to a boil; pour over biscuits.They may float

column1: honey-brined-smoked-turkey-264672|Honey Brined Smoked Turkey|Combine the hot water and the salt in a 54-quart cooler. Stir until the salt dissolves. Stir in the vegetable broth and the honey. Add the ice and stir. Place the turkey in the brine
column3: and cover with cooler lid. Brine overnight
column4: up to 12 hours.Remove the turkey from the brine and dry thoroughly. Rub the bird thoroughly with the vegetable oil.Heat the grill to 400 degrees F.Using a double thickness of heavy-duty aluminum foil
column5: build a smoke bomb. Place a cup of hickory wood chips in the center of the foil and gather up the edges
column6: making a small pouch. Leave the pouch open at the top. Set this directly on the charcoal or on the metal bar over the gas flame. Set the turkey over indirect heat
column7: insert a probe thermometer into the thickest part of the breast meat
column8: and set the alarm for 160 degrees F. Close the lid and cook for 1 hour.After 1 hour check the bird; if the skin is golden brown
column9: cover with aluminum foil and continue cooking. Also
column11: replace wood chips with second cup.Once the bird reaches 160 degrees F
column14: and allow to rest for 1 hour. Carve and serve.Recipe Summary.Difficulty: EasyPrep Time: 15 minutesInactive Prep Time: 13 minutesCook Time: 4 hoursYield: 10 to 12 servings.
